intro: Hibbertia lactucifolia, commonly known as the milkweed hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are ovate with serrated edges, and it produces small, greenish-yellow fruits that contain seeds. Hibbertia lactucifolia is often found in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia.
